It is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage and compact growth habit, which helps it retain moisture in its often arid habitat. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink, adding to its ornamental appeal. Its leaves are thick and leathery, adapted to reduce water loss and withstand harsh environmental conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural habitat.
